contentrichtext.text: Three ships of the [[Royal Navy]] have borne the name '''HMS''' '''''Manchester''''' after the city of [[Manchester]] in the north-west of [[England]]. * HMS ''Manchester'' was a hired store ship in 1814 <ref>http://www.royalnavy.mod.uk/operations-and-support/surface-fleet/type-42-destroyers/hms-manchester/history/</ref> * {{HMS|Manchester|15|6}} was a {{sclass2-|Town|cruiser (1936)|0}} cruiser launched in 1937 and lost in action in 1942. * {{HMS|Manchester|D95|6}} is a [[Type 42]] (Batch 3) [[destroyer]] launched in 1980. She participated in the 1991 [[Gulf War]] and was decommissioned on 17 February 2011. ==Battle honours== * [[Norwegian campaign|Norway]] 1940 * [[Battle of Cape Spartivento|Spartivento]] 1940 * [[Siege of Malta (1940)|Malta]] 1942 * [[Arctic convoys of World War II|Arctic]] 1942 * [[Gulf War|Persian Gulf]] 1991 ==Notes and references== {{reflist}} {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Manchester, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
